ai-kv2.9:22.5_0: “Mendicants, the ocean gradually slants, slopes, and inclines, with no abrupt precipice.
ai-kv2.9:22.6_0: In the same way in this teaching and training the penetration to enlightenment comes from gradual training, progress, and practice, not abruptly.”
ai-kv2.9:24.1_0: Step by step, by a wise one,
ai-kv2.9:24.3_0: bit by bit, moment by moment,
ai-kv2.9:26.3_0: Gavampati said to those senior monks,
ai-kv2.9:26.4_0: “Reverend, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
ai-kv2.9:26.5_0: ‘Mendicants, someone who sees suffering also sees suffering, the origin of suffering, and the cessation of suffering.
ai-kv2.9:26.6_0: Someone who sees the origin of suffering also sees suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.
ai-kv2.9:26.7_0: Someone who sees the cessation of suffering also sees suffering, the origin of suffering, and the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.
ai-kv2.9:26.8_0: Someone who sees the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering also sees suffering, the origin of suffering, and the cessation of suffering.’”
ai-kv2.9:28.2_0: there are three things that are given up:
ai-kv2.9:28.5_0: They’re freed from the four places of loss,
ai-kv2.9:28.6_0: and unable to perform the six grave crimes.”
ai-kv2.9:30.4_0: “Mendicants, when a noble disciple stains the stainless, immaculate vision of the Truth:
ai-kv2.9:30.5_0: ‘Everything that has a beginning has an end.’ They give up the three fetters.
ai-kv2.9:30.6_0: Identity view, doubt, misapprehension of precepts and observances, and misapprehension of precepts and observances.”
ai-kv2.9:30.11_0: The discussion on the gradual occasions is finished.
